meanings.definition: Somewhat dark in color; dimly lit.
meanings.sent1: The dusky room made it hard to see clearly.
meanings.sent2: The forest became dusky as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The dusky sky looked like a giant blanket covering the earth.
meanings.sent4: Her dusky mood matched the stormy weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The dusky shadows danced on the walls, creating a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The alley was dusky and filled with unknown sounds.
meanings.sent2: The dusky figure disappeared into the night.
meanings.sent3: The dusky corners of the room seemed to whisper secrets.
meanings.sent4: His dusky thoughts clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The dusky path ahead seemed both eerie and intriguing.

meanings.definition: Having a dark complexion or skin tone.
meanings.sent1: Her dusky skin glowed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The dusky beauty of her features was captivating.
meanings.sent3: The dusky tone of his voice added depth to his singing.
meanings.sent4: In the dusky light, her complexion appeared even more striking.
meanings.sent5: The dusky hues of her makeup complemented her natural skin tone perfectly.
